solution_line_template: Sansa earns ${price_8in} x {num_8in_per_day} = $<<{price_8in}*{num_8in_per_day}={earnings_8in_per_day}>>{earnings_8in_per_day} every day by selling three 8-inch portraits.
The price of the 16-inch portrait is ${price_8in} x {multiplier_16in} = $<<{price_8in}*{multiplier_16in}={price_16in}>>{price_16in} each.
So, she earns ${price_16in} x {num_16in_per_day} = $<<{price_16in}*{num_16in_per_day}={earnings_16in_per_day}>>{earnings_16in_per_day} every day by selling five 16-inch portraits.
Her total earnings is ${earnings_16in_per_day} + ${earnings_8in_per_day} = $<<{earnings_16in_per_day}+{earnings_8in_per_day}={total_earnings_per_day}>>{total_earnings_per_day} every day.
Therefore, the total amount she earns after {num_days} days is ${total_earnings_per_day} x {num_days} = $<<{total_earnings_per_day}*{num_days}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings}.
